poem:
**Transcendent Cinema**

Spotlights flicker on uncharted scripts,  
frames paint stories in colors unpinned,  
weave through the lens of truth, where  
whispers become shouts. Through starlit halls,  
echoes of silenced voices rise,  
the reel rewinds old shadows.  
This season, a curtain call,  
and possibility pirouettes  
in arcs of becoming.  
Curtains lift for the luminous.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Could this be a historic year for trans representation at the Oscars? Strangely, improbably, as we move toward Oscar season, there are two trans films that are considered serious contenders for major awards – including one that could possibly even land best picture. To say that this has never happened before is an understatement. The Oscars tend to be an extremely heteronormative affair – you have to go back to 2017 to see the last". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
